p: The west-central part of Morocco, between 32 °N and 29 °N latitude, has a rich and diversified flora and is characterized by a considerable number of endemic species. The sector covers an area of 2,560,000 ha representing all of the Arganeraie Biosphere Reserve. The region is in the transitional area between the Mediterranean iso-climatic zone in the north and the Saharan region in the south and has a wide opening to the Atlantic Ocean. The flora is mostly made up of Mediterranean taxa, coexisting with tropical, Saharan, Macaronesia, and endemic taxa (Msanda et al. 2005). A total of 1440 plant taxa have been recorded, and some parts of this area have acted as major refugia for the tertiary paleoflora (Médail and Quézel 1999). Within the area, endemism represents 140 species and subspecies (Peltier 1982; M’hirit et al. 1998).
